alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 12:44PM PST until January 10 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible within the entire Watch area. Areas of most concern include the Alisal burn , urban roads and freeways, and in creeks and streams. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following areas, Cuyama Valley, Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches, Santa Barbara County Inland Central Coast, Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains, Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range, Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range and Santa Ynez Valley. * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks, streams and low-lying areas. Rock slides and mud slides may become a significant problem. In addition, the Sisquoc River at Garey is expected to exceed monitor stage by 9 PM PST this evening, peaking at around 11.5 feet late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong Pacific storm system will bring periods of widespread heavy rainfall with rates between one half and one inch per hour, possibly higher near thunderstorms and favored foothill areas. Rainfall totals of 2 to 5 inches are expected in coast and valley areas, with 4 to 8 inches expected in the foothills and mountains. Local rainfall totals over 10 inches are possible. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop or if evacuations are ordered.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
